DOC.brief_summary: This single-center , randomize , double-blind ( subject/evaluator ) study . Enrolled patient anterior cruciate ligament ( ACL ) reconstruction meet criterion advanced rehabilitation . The study include 8 week advanced rehabilitation consist low- high-intensity plyometric exercise . The objective study determine effect plyometric exercise intensity knee function knee cartilage patient ACL reconstruction .
DOC.brief_title: Anterior Cruciate Ligament Reconstruction Plyometric Exercise
DOC.detailed_description: As part study , investigator insure patient meet criterion advance rehabilitation base knee motion , pain level quadriceps strength . Participants ask review inform consent consent study prior study procedure . The study consist 2 test session 8 week intervention ( 2 visit per week ) UF & Shands Orthopaedics Sports Medicine Institute . The testing session include clinical measure knee impairment , questionnaire , biomechanical analysis functional performance testing .
DOC.criteria: 1. time injury ACL reconstruction great 6 month , 2. preinjury activity level include participation highdemand activity , 3. meet criterion advance rehabilitation include full active knee extension , active knee flexion within 5 degree contralateral side , pain rating great equal 1/10 activity daily live , involved side knee extensor strength least 60 % contralateral side . 1. bilateral knee injury , 2. prior knee ligament injury and/or surgery , 3. concomitant ligamentous injury > Grade I , 4. meniscal repair perform conjunction ACL reconstruction , 5. cartilage repair procedure perform conjunction ACL reconstruction , 6. complication surgery require protocol modification , 7. renal disease .
